content.title: Fruit Development Scheme
content.details: The scheme ‘Fruit Development Scheme’ was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya to make available to the farmers good quality planting materials in convergence mode and sale at subsidized rates.
benefits: Quality planting materials for sale at 50% subsidy and free of cost to the farmers under convergent mode with MGNREGA.
Assistance for citrus rejuvenation programme for senile orchards.
75% subsidy assistance for creeper fruit plants limited to 500 sqm per beneficiary.
eligibility: The applicant/farmer should be a resident of Meghalaya.
The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in Agriculture, possessing own or leased land of at least 0.2 hectares or more.
content.application_process: Offline. The eligible bonafide farmer can apply/write an application on plain paper and submit it at the nearest office of the Horticulture Development Officer.
documents_required: Documents proof of possessing own or leased land

faqs.question: What is the key objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To make available to the farmers good quality planting materials in convergence mode and sale at subsidised rates.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya has launched this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the type of assistance and entitlement?
faqs.answer: The Scheme assists in providing good quality planting materials including horticultural tools and implements at subsidized rates for promoting fruit cultivation.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Bonafide farmers engaged in Agriculture, possessing own or leased land of at least 0.2 hectares or more.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Bonafide farmers can apply in plain paper through the nearest Horticulture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Horticulture Circle.
